channel.title: Hi there! on Jun Woo Shin
channel.description: Recent content in Hi there! on Jun Woo Shin

item.title: CHIP8
item.description: GitHub: chip8 Demo: N/A I’ve always been interested in emulation - it seemed incredible that we could bring back past hardware and software.

item.title: Rainbow GIF
item.description: GitHub: rainbowgif Demo: N/A I’m a huge fan of Slack’s custom emojis and the various collections that have surfaced.

item.title: Done with School
item.description: After spending nearly your whole life doing something, it’s kind of weird to just stop. Sure, school sucked but it just sort of became a part of my life.

item.title: Leaving Work
item.description: There’s a certain sadness in leaving a job. Sure it’s not graduating from school or leaving a close group of friends, but nevertheless each time I feel a bit melancholy.

item.title: C Snake
item.description: GitHub: snake Demo: N/A As I was an avid user of terminal applications as well as command line applications, I came to learn about ncurses, a TUI library.

item.title: Recruiting
item.description: At the end of my summer, I realized with dread that I hadn’t done any studying for interviews at all or started looking for jobs at all.

item.title: Game of Life
item.description: GitHub: game of life Demo: N/A Functional programming always piqued my interest so I wanted to take the time to learn one and use it in a project.

item.title: Chrome Storage
item.description: GitHub: chrome storage Demo: N/A The Chrome brower has a storage API for storing data, acting as a sort of database for the extensions and now deprecated applications.

item.title: hackNY 2017
item.description: Itâ€™s currently 2:00 AM, August 12th, 2017 - just a full week since hackNY officially ended.

item.title: Light Source
item.description: Canon EOS 70D 10mm | F/4.5 | 1/50 sec | ISO 400 Oftentimes I will regret that I didn’t bring my camera somewhere.

item.title: Todo
item.description: GitHub: todo Demo: https://jwoos.github.io/web_todo/ Having started off as a web developer, I always wanted to stay on top of the current frameworks.

item.title: Frontend Please
item.description: Ever since I finally got around to uninstalling Lazarus, I had determined that I would make an extension to fulfill the void that it left.

item.title: The Singers of Central Park
item.description: Nikon D5300 35mm | F/1.8 | 1/160 sec | ISO 400 When you live in New York City, you get used to a lot of things - the handing out of mixtapes, street performances, and a lot more.

item.title: Another Shell
item.description: GitHub: ash Demo: N/A I’ve been using the commandline for a while, especially Bash but I never thought about how they had been developed or their inner workings.

item.title: Android
item.description: My first phone was a Motorola Razer, I’m sure you have fond memory of those. After that it was the sidekick LX and then a Blackberry.

item.title: Slack Zmachine
item.description: GitHub: slack zmachine Demo: N/A This is a simple slack bot to allow users to play zmachine text based games through Slack.

item.title: GitSync
item.description: GitHub: GitSync Demo: N/A GitSync is an application to sync between a remote Git source and a local Git source.

item.title: JavaScript Frotz
item.description: GitHub: JavaScript Frotz Demo: N/A Frotz is a zmachine interpreter for text based games, such as Zork.

item.title: Making Titles is Hard
item.description: Nikon D5300 35mm | F/4 | 1/500 sec | ISO 100 I’ve never been one for titles.

item.title: Themes
item.description: For as long as I can remember, theming was very important to me. Aesthetics. My idea was that if I were going to use something, it should look nice so that I would enjoy using it.

item.title: Asthma
item.description: It was a cold day and I could feel my feet beginning to get cold. A little itch began to creep up my throat, bringing out a small cough - much better.

item.title: I'm Kind of Lazy
item.description: I’ve never considered myself to be especially unhealthy or not fit. There was a period in time in which I rarely went outside around early elementary school days, but besides that I was actively going out to play.

item.title: A Rainy Fourth Of July
item.description: Nikon D5300 18mm | F/20 | 1/3 sec | ISO 100 My friends and I decided to bike to Booklyn Heights Promenade to watch the Macy’s Fourth of July fireworks show.

item.title: Pocketistic
item.description: I like to think that I am a decent reader - Pocket certainly seemed to think so.

item.title: Straight Down A SoHo Street
item.description: Nikon D5300 18mm | F/4 | 1/800 sec | ISO 100 This was taken when I was walking around SoHo with my friend and he suddenly said “this would be a nice shot” as we were crossing the street.

item.title: Reviving the Blog
item.description: It’s been a few months since my last post because I’ve just been so busy with school.

item.title: Clock
item.description: GitHub: clock Demo: https://jwoos.github.io/web_clock/ This is a simple clock that I made. I had planned on making it much fancier with smooth animations and better styling but this is just what I ended up with!

item.title: Another New Computer
item.description: After dealing with a very old and sluggish desktop for a long time, I finally had enough and decided to build my own computer.

item.title: New Computer
item.description: I’ve always been into computers, but interestingly enough I never bought a good one that I actually wanted.

item.title: Why doesn't my school encourage learning?
item.description: I’m a freshman in NYU Tandon School of Engineering. As a computer science major, I was excited to find that I would be taking Python in my first semester, a language that I had some experience with already.

item.title: Diceware
item.description: GitHub: diceware Demo: N/A After reading an article about a little girl making diceware passwords and selling them, I became interested in automating that process.

item.title: Spread Too Thin
item.description: Ever since I could remember, I was always so ambitious. There were so many things that I wanted to do and so many things that I wanted to learn.

item.title: GitHub Blog
item.description: I’ve been meaning to make blog using GitHub’s built in system using Jekyll. But of course I got distracted and never quite got around to it.

item.title: Geocoder
item.description: GitHub: geocoder Demo: https://jwoos.github.io/web_geocoder/ I was playing around with Google’s location API, when I found the geocoding API.
